name: Kael, the Forgemaster
description: God of the forge, endurance, and creation. Worshipped by artisans and soldiers. His temples are active forges, and his priests are master smiths.
tenet: True worth is forged in hardship

name: Lyra, the Watcher
description: Goddess of stars, destiny, and knowledge. Patron of scholars and navigators. Her temples are observatories with ceilings open to the night sky.
tenet: All that is, was, and will be is written in the heavens

name: The All-Mother
description: Goddess of life, healing, and community. Worshipped in every Heartland village, patron of healers and farmers. Her symbol is a tree with roots encircling the world.
tenet: All beings are connected; the whole is greater than the parts

name: The Silent Path
description: A widespread philosophy of inner peace and mental discipline. Adherents believe true power comes from mastering the self, not from external gods. They practice meditation.

name: The Logic of The Cog
description: Popular in the Vaneer Concord. Followers believe the universe is a complex machine understood through science and reason, viewing faith as a relic of a less-enlightened age.

name: Grak, the Beast-Father
description: Primal god of the hunt, instinct, and the wild. Revered by hunters and nomads. Worshipped in the wilderness.
tenet: Trust your instincts; they are the whispers of the god

name: Faith in the Great Wolf
description: Worship of the pack leader, god of hunt, loyalty, strength in numbers.

name: Faith in the All-Mother Bear
description: Reverence for the protector, goddess of resilience, family, fierce defense.

name: Faith in the Silent Stag
description: Following the king of the forest, god of stoicism, guidance, natural authority.

name: Faith in the Trickster Coyote
description: Praise for the clever survivor, god of wit, adaptation, bending rules.

name: The Law of the Pack
description: Belief that individual strength serves group strength, and vice-versa.

name: The Long Endurance
description: Belief that true victory belongs to the one who refuses to fall.

name: The Alpha's Will
description: Belief that 'gods' are merely powerful individuals; true authority is earned.

name: Social Dynamics
description: Study of intricate workings of societies, believing they can be understood and perfected.

name: Applied Husbandry
description: Belief in improving the world through careful cultivation and breeding, not prayer.

name: The Self-Made Mammal
description: No belief in gods, trusting only in one's senses and kin's strength.

name: The Grazing Path
description: Gods, Dragons are just noise; focus on the present.

name: Faith in the Greatwood
description: Worship of the ancient forest as a single, slumbering intelligence.

name: Faith in the Mycelial Mind
description: Belief that all fungi are part of a single, vast, subterranean consciousness.

name: Faith in the Spore-Mother
description: Reverence for the goddess of decay, rebirth, and spreading new life.

name: Faith in the Sun-Petal
description: Praise for the goddess of sunlight, beauty, and vibrant growth.

name: The Law of Cycles
description: Belief that all things must die to feed new life; transformation, not an end.

name: Rooted Stillness
description: Belief that true power comes from patience, observation, deep roots, not action.

name: The Silent Growth
description: The forest grows, rot spreads, sun shines without divine command.

name: Botany
description: Study of intricate plant biology, seeing them as complex living machines.

name: Geology
description: Study of soil and rock as the world's true foundation.

name: The Logic of Photosynthesis
description: Belief in observable life processes, not unseen gods.

name: The Patient Bough
description: Storms and seasons pass; it is of no concern, we remain.

name: The Cult of the Wyrm Ascendant
description: A dangerous heresy secretly worshipping the Chaos Dragons as gods of change. They practice forbidden rituals to awaken their masters, operating from hidden cells in major cities and remote ruins.
